Activity: Full-day workshop (8 h; PhD students): Recording, Analyzing and Using Physiological Signals in Psychology. Reference: \href{https://psychologie.unibas.ch/de/personen/dorothee-bentz/}{\color[HTML]{1976D2}{Dr Dorothee Bentz}}.

Online workshop (24 h; PhD students): Advanced Python programming for signal processing and data analysis. Reference: \href{https://www.psychologie.uzh.ch/de/studium/doktorat/team.html}{\color[HTML]{1976D2}{Dr Maike Krannich}}.

Modules (192 h; bachelor \& master students): Neurology and psychiatry (main neurodegenerative, neurological and psychiatric disorders), assessment (examination, diagnostic, psychometry), rehabilitation and psychotherapy (CBT, mindfulness-based therapies, cognitive rehabilitation, practice supervision), general neuroscience and psychology (neuroanatomy, emotion regulation...). Reference: \href{http://recherche.parisdescartes.fr/LaboratoireMemoireCognition/Membres/Enseignants-Chercheurs/Isabelle-Jambaque-Aubourg}{\color[HTML]{1976D2}{Pr Isabelle Jambaqué}}.

Modules (144 h; 1st \& 2nd year students): Experimental methodology (assessment and related problems, scientific reasoning, psychometric properties of tests and questionnaires, statistics...) and introduction to concepts such as intelligence, personality and creativity. Reference: Dr Christophe Mouchiroud.

Modules (48 h; 3rd year students): Models of working memory, mental imagery and categorisation. Reference: \href{https://lapea.recherche.parisdescartes.fr/membres-permanents/todd-lubart/}{\color[HTML]{1976D2}{Pr Todd Lubart}}.
